name: places/ChIJbU2KHoVZwokRTQErINAVD5g
adrFormatAddress: 317 Bowery, New York, NY 10003-7105, USA

originalText.text: The homeless services only gets more than 1 star due to the size and scale of the operation being so impressive.  Most cities have maybe 2 or 3 shelters and/or a soup kitchen or 2.  NYC has it's own homeless services NETWORK.  The shear size of this undertaking alone, is impressive although unfortunately still NOT ENOUGH to truly handle the ENTIRE homelessness issue in NYC.  Actually, it's most-likely the largest service of it's kind coming out of any other large U.S. cities.  However, the bigger the system... the more broken it seems to always get!  Sometimes I just see so much homelessness and wonder how...but then I realize just how dangerous mostly all homeless shelters in NYC are on a daily basis.  This is why so many people choose to stay outside, on the streets, because the shelters are such a huge safety and life risk.  Imagine that.  The city-provided assistance for homeless individuals is considered WORSE than sleeping on a sidewalk!

originalText.text: What to get life in order and while having a place to stay with great accommodations and help. There is no reason people need to be in the shelter system for long because it so many opportunities without worrying about rent and washing clothes plus your feed breakfast, lunch and dinner.
